about_the_game:
Sensory Deprivation


DeafBlind is a really cool game that takes you to a place where you can't see or hear anything. It's like nothing else out there because it tries to show you what it's like to be both deaf and blind. It's all about diving deep into what it feels like to not have your usual senses.

Tip: For the best experience, we recommend using headphones or earplugs along with a blindfold (Unless you already are deaf and/or blind)

Gameplay


When you play DeafBlind, the screen is just black, and it's totally quiet. Winning or losing isn't the point of the game; it's more about seeing what it's like to live in a world where you can't rely on your eyes or ears, just on touching and feeling stuff.

Achievements


The game has these cool achievements that you get as you make your way through the darkness. They're not just regular goals; they tell a story about everything you do in the game.

This game is made for anyone who's up for trying something really different. It invites you to check out a world that's hidden and silent, pushing you to get used to it and find some kind of meaning when you can't immediately see or hear what's going on.

DeafBlind wants you to just dive in and experience the deep quiet and the big darkness—find out what's waiting beyond what you can normally sense.

short_description: DeafBlind offers an immersive sensory deprivation experience, simulating what life might feel like if you were both deaf and blind. This game invites you to navigate a world shrouded in silence and darkness, challenging you to adapt and explore in entirely new ways.
